name: Park My SpaceShip
description:
Spaceflight is harder than it seems...

-Use the Reckless Abandon's four engines to get past dangerous hazards and stay in the goal to complete the stage without taking too much damage or floating away.

-Like controlling a tank, fire both rear engines to go forwards, both front engines to go backwards, or two diagonally opposite engines to rotate. But remember though: there are no brakes in space, so getting the ship to stop without wandering off is no picnic!

-Ruthlessly unyielding walls, bombs of instant death, anti-gravitic white holes, and pesky doors that won't stay open will put your piloting skills to the test.

-Easy to learn but hard to master. Awkward at first but glorious once you get the hang of it.

-Set the resolution up to 4k or as low as 128 x 72 because it's funny.

-Expected play time: 45 minutes to an hour if you're not particularly awful at it. Speedruns under 15 minutes are possible if you can git gud enough.

-Inspired by the flash games of yore and spaceflight games of yore's yore.
